titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Yōko Hioki Photograph Album, around 1944-1954 RL.11606
titlestmt.author: Alice Poffinberger

publicationstmt.publisher: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2018-03-22 15:19:58 -0400.

repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Yōko Hioki was born about 1938 and was a resident of Ōmiya-shi, Saitama, Japan, near Tokyō. Collection comprises a photograph album maintained by Yōko Hioki primarily featuring her family and school. She was a 9th grader in 1953. There are 128 albumen and gelatin silver photographs ranging in size from 0.875 x 1.375-inches to 7.75 x 5.5-inches. The majority of the photographs are captioned. The first photograph in the album is a group family photograph taken sometime during the war, before the deployment of one of her family members. In addition, besides several pictures of Yōko, there are group and individual photographs of her school teachers and classmates, including reunion photographs, and many images of class field trips, including one trip to Nikko. There are also casual and formal individual and group images of Yōko's family, including those taken at a birthday party for her sister.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Yōko Hioki was born about 1938 and was a resident of Ōmiya-shi, Saitama, Japan, near Tokyō.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Yōko Hioki Photograph Album was received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a purchase in 2017.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Yōko Hioki Photograph Album, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this collection guide: 2017-0161

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection comprises a photograph album maintained by Yōko Hioki primarily featuring her family and school. She was a 9th grader in 1953. There are 128 albumen and gelatin silver photographs ranging in size from 0.875 x 1.375-inches to 7.75 x 5.5-inches. The majority of the photographs are captioned. The first photograph in the album is a group family photograph taken sometime during the war, before the deployment of one of her family members. In addition, besides several pictures of Yōko, there are group and individual photographs of her school teachers and classmates, including reunion photographs, and many images of class field trips, including one trip to Nikko. There are also casual and formal individual and group images of Yōko's family, including those taken at a birthday party for her sister.
